ssc_usart.c File Reference

Detailed Description

SSC USART example driver.

This file defines a useful set of functions for the SSC USART interface on AVR32 devices. The driver handles normal polled usage and direct memory access (PDC) usage.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with a SSC module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file ssc_usart.c.

#include "ssc_usart.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Function Documentation

static int get_parity_bit ( unsigned short  ch  )  [static]

Finds the actual parity bit.

Finds whether the parity bit is zero or one, based on the current settings and the word to send.

Parameters:
ch Word to send
Return values:
0 Parity bit should be 0
1 Parity bit should be 1

00118         if ( has_even_parity(ch) )

00120         else
00121             return 0;
00122     }

static int get_stop_bits (  )  [static]

Returns the stop bit(s) to send.

Returns the stop bits (0, 1, 11) based on current settings.

Returns:
0b0, 0b1 or 0b11 according to *opts

static int has_even_parity ( unsigned short  ch  )  [static]

Determines whether the argument has even parity.

This function returns whether the argument has even or odd parity. It returns 1 for even parity.

Parameters:
ch Word to count bits set in.
Return values:
0 The count of 1's in ch is odd
1 The count of 1's in ch is even.

static int setClockDivider ( volatile avr32_ssc_t *  ssc,
unsigned int  bit_rate,
long  pbaHz 
) [static]

Sets the clock divider (DIV-field in CMR-register).

This function sets the DIV field in the CMR-register to correct divider so that the divided clock runs at the specified rate.

Note:
Clock divider is always rounded down, this means that the desired clock will be correct or faster than desired clock rate.
Parameters:
ssc Base address of SSC.
bit_rate Desired clock rate (bit rate).
pbaHz PBA frequency (in Herz)

Todo:
check input values

int ssc_uart_getchar ( volatile avr32_ssc_t *  ssc  ) 

Reads a character from SSC UART.

This function reads a character from SSC UART. It starts a busy waiting loop and there is no timeout.

Parameters:
ssc Pointer to base address of SSC.
Return values:
SSC_RX_ERROR Buffer underrun error.
Returns:
Returns character read.

int ssc_uart_init ( volatile avr32_ssc_t *  ssc,
int  baud_rate,
int  stop_bits,
int  parity_bits,
int  char_len,
int  loop_back,
long  pbaHz 
)

Sets up an SSC as UART.

Initializes an SSC for use as USART, by setting appropriate registers

Parameters:
ssc Pointer to base address of SSC.
baud_rate Desired baud rate
stop_bits Stop bit setting.
  • SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE One stop bit.
  • SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE_AND_HALF 1.5 stop bits.
  • SSC_UART_STOPBITS_TWO Two stop bits.
parity_bits Parity bit setting.
  • SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE No parity bit.
  • SSC_UART_PARITY_ODD Odd parity bit.
  • SSC_UART_PARITY_EVEN Even parity bit.
  • SSC_UART_PARITY_SPACE Parity bit always 0.
  • SSC_UART_PARITY_MARK Parity bit always 1.
char_len Number of bits per symbol. May be 5,6,7,8 or 9.
loop_back Loopback mode enable/disable (SSC_UART_LOOPBACK_MODE_ENABLE or SSC_UART_LOOPBACK_MODE_DISABLE)
pbaHz PBA frequency (in Herz)
Return values:
SSC_SUCCESS On success.
SSC_BAD_ARGS On invalid arguments.

00212     //   CKS - use divided clock, CKO - continuous transmit clock,
00213     //   CKI - shift data on falling clock, START - immediately after data
00214     //   is inserted in THR. STTDLY, PERIOD - not used.
00215     ssc->tcmr =
00216              (0<<AVR32_SSC_TCMR_CKS_OFFSET)|

00224     // Set transmit frame mode:
00225     //  DATNB - Transfer one word, MSBF - transmit lsb first,
00226     //  DATDEF - Default to one, FSEDGE, FSDEN, FSOS, FSLEN  - not used,
00227     //  DATLEN - stop_bits+parity_bits+char_length
00228     //  (If stopbits=1.5, transmit two)
00229     ssc->tfmr =
00230             ( ( (stop_bits==SSC_UART_STOPBITS_ONE?1:2) + (parity_bits==0?0:1) + char_len ) << AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATLEN_OFFSET )|
00231             (1<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATDEF_OFFSET)|
00232             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_MSBF_OFFSET)|
00233             (1<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_DATNB_OFFSET)|
00234             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSLEN_OFFSET)|

00236             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSDEN_OFFSET)|
00237             (0<<AVR32_SSC_TFMR_FSEDGE_OFFSET);
00238 
00239     // Set receive clock mode:
00240     //   CKS - use divided clock, CKO - continuous transmit clock,
00241     //   CKI - shift data on falling edge, START - immediately after data
00242     //   STOP - wait for new compare 0 after finishing transfer,
00243     //   STTDLY, PERIOD - not used
00244     ssc->rcmr =
00245           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKS_OFFSET)|
00246           (2<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKO_OFFSET)|
00247           (1<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKI_OFFSET)|
00248           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_CKG_OFFSET)|
00249           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_START_OFFSET)|
00250           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_STOP_OFFSET)|
00251           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_STTDLY_OFFSET)|
00252           (0<<AVR32_SSC_RCMR_PERIOD_OFFSET);
00253 
00254     // Set receive frame mode:
00255     //   DATLEN - stop_bits+start_bits+parity_bits+char_len,
00256     //   (if 1.5 stop bits just take one)
00257     //   LOOP - YES loopback, MSBF - lsb first, DATNB - transmit one per sync,
00258     //   FSLEN - 1 bit (start bit), FSOS, FSEDGE - not used
00259     ssc->rfmr =
00260               ( ( (stop_bits==0?0:1) +1 +(parity_bits==0?0:1) +char_len ) <<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_DATLEN_OFFSET )|
00261               ((loop_back==SSC_UART_LOOPBACK_MODE_ENABLE?1:0)<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_LOOP_OFFSET)|
00262               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_MSBF_OFFSET)|
00263               (1<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_DATNB_OFFSET)|
00264               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSLEN_OFFSET)|
00265               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSOS_OFFSET)|
00266               (0<<AVR32_SSC_RFMR_FSEDGE_OFFSET);
00267 
00268 
00269     // Set compare 0-register
00270     ssc->rc0r = (0<<AVR32_SSC_RC0R_CP0_OFFSET);
00271 
00272     // Enable receiver and transceiver
00273     ssc->cr = (1<<AVR32_SSC_CR_TXEN_OFFSET)|(1<<AVR32_SSC_CR_RXEN_OFFSET);
00274     return SSC_UART_SUCCESS;
00275 }

int ssc_uart_putchar ( volatile avr32_ssc_t *  ssc,
unsigned short  ch 
)

Writes a character to SSC UART.

This function writes a character to SSC UART. It waits a short while if UART is not ready to send, if still not ready it returns a timeout.

Parameters:
ssc Pointer to base address of SSC.
ch Character to send
Return values:
SSC_UART_SUCCESS Character was successfully sent
SSC_UART_TIMEOUT Timed out while trying to send.

00331 {
00332     unsigned int word = 0 ;
00333     int timeout = SSC_UART_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;
00334 
00335     // Shift data one bit right (because of start-bit) and put in word
00336     //   The left-most bit is always zero, and is the start-bit
00337     word = (ch) << 1 ;
00338 
00339     // If parity-bit, find it, shift it past data and start-bit, and add.
00340     //   Then add stop bits after that.
00341     if (opt.parity != SSC_UART_PARITY_NONE)
00342         word |= (get_parity_bit(ch) << (opt.char_len+1)) |
00343           (get_stop_bits() << (opt.char_len+2));
00344 
00345     // If no parity bit, add stop bit after data.
00346     else
00347         word |= (get_stop_bits() << (opt.char_len+1));
00348 
00349     // wait for Transmit ready
00350         while( ( ssc->sr & (1<<AVR32_SSC_SR_TXRDY_OFFSET) ) == 0 &&
00351             timeout > 0 ) {
00352           timeout--;
00353         }
00354 
00355     // If timeout, return TIMEOUT
00356     if (timeout == 0)
00357         return SSC_UART_TIMEOUT;
00358

00360     ssc->thr = word ;
00361 
00362     return SSC_UART_SUCCESS;

static int ssc_uart_validate ( unsigned short  ch  )  [static]

Validates a received word

This function validates a received word, including stopbits, parity bit [and startbit?]. On failure it sets error flags.

Parameters:
ch Word received
Returns:
Non-negative number: Word without start,stop and parity bits
Return values:
SSC_UART_FAILURE Word is invalid. Sets appropriate error flag in option struct

Variable Documentation

ssc_uart_opt_t opt [static]

Static option struct, used to hold options between ssc_uart_init() and calls to ssc_uart_putchar() and ssc_uart_getchar()
